metadata.title: CVE-2018-17189 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In Apache HTTP server versions 2.4.37 and prior, by sending request bodiesin a slow loris way to plain resources, the h2 stream for that requestunnecessarily occupied a server thread cleaning up that incoming data. Thisaffects only HTTP/2 (mod_http2) connections.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17189` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6').
